Articles.Content:
well your not the only juggernaut out there wolfman29 im bringing this monster of a lifter to the party meet my eeloo Heavy lifter mk3 with a payload to orbit and deorbit itself 

![9902bd3bc6d3084f06ba0765dbadb3d6.jpg](https://i.gyazo.com/9902bd3bc6d3084f06ba0765dbadb3d6.jpg)

I have problems calculating mass into tons i definitely have plenty of delta v though to get it sky borne though ill post more pictures when i have the chance tomorrow

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-14T03:55:58Z" title="08/14/2015 03:55  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 14, 2015</time> by Lego8\_bit**
So in KSP, mass in tons is just 1000kg (which is used somewhere in the world, just not sure where). So right now, your lifter is sitting in at a comfortable 931 tons!
holy krakenpipes well thanks for that calculation wolfman29 im gonna see if i can even manage to manualy fly this into a 70k orbit well lets just say im not perfect at doing that

I added your updated entry to the board, wolfman29, well done.

Looking forward to your completed entry, Lego8\_bit.
well im in a higher than intended stable orbit for now im gonna try to make a maneuver to goto 70k on ap and pareap

be warned this might take half the page for pics. And usually i would have All my reaction wheels online but due to the rules i only had my payload reaction wheel online and let me tell you DAM it was hard to steer that danged thing into orbit ESPECIALLY IN ORBIT i also forgot to de-fill my 4 engine batteries but i did cut them of from the main battery charge. but i do have a strong re-gen system in place even when there is no sun so the main battery stayed topped off. (that's until the last stage...ions engines)after 11 corrections to my orbit the lowest ap that i could do by hand was 70K orbit. thats the best i could do without de orbiting myself. 

WE HAVE LIFT OFF!

![f288c42fb2a3a44465a00e5eb6901d67.jpg](https://i.gyazo.com/f288c42fb2a3a44465a00e5eb6901d67.jpg)

First stage Depleted and ditched....

![cd0a7152b27cdf294fd1a9f6940e997b.jpg](https://i.gyazo.com/cd0a7152b27cdf294fd1a9f6940e997b.jpg)

second stage depleted and diched third and final part of the lifter was for the rest of the manuvering. before i release the payload.

![41ddd4e140eed001f2a61d7e09059ebe.png](https://i.gyazo.com/41ddd4e140eed001f2a61d7e09059ebe.png)

![38ffa1ae722cb602333da324e7713744.png](https://i.gyazo.com/38ffa1ae722cb602333da324e7713744.png)

![0858deac894baf1f2e167b85d570bf1e.png](https://i.gyazo.com/0858deac894baf1f2e167b85d570bf1e.png)

![be268bd09eed8ef87d997167264e1afa.png](https://i.gyazo.com/be268bd09eed8ef87d997167264e1afa.png)

Final maneuver before payload release had about 1200 units of fuel left in the tank.

![deb3f5463f98a7f42586c76d0eeee52f.png](https://i.gyazo.com/deb3f5463f98a7f42586c76d0eeee52f.png)

Payload Relasaed! eeloo pod activated. Payload weight Was 65.9 tons i think.

![ce147a2bc74faf5fbf4adeb17b12bb3d.png](https://i.gyazo.com/ce147a2bc74faf5fbf4adeb17b12bb3d.png)

Did i few more VERY FINE manuvers that only required 5.0 untis of fuel or less

![322cb207e97414f1fcc8316974e4351d.jpg](https://i.gyazo.com/322cb207e97414f1fcc8316974e4351d.jpg)

![01c1807ef9fe107340dd706657b67b60.png](https://i.gyazo.com/01c1807ef9fe107340dd706657b67b60.png)

if anyone can confirm the total payload weight that would be fine.

![f6c5c2676bc6c5071c79b0fed344b50a.png](https://i.gyazo.com/f6c5c2676bc6c5071c79b0fed344b50a.png)

final tweaks to the orbit.

![b4c446cc016138263957034390c88663.png](https://i.gyazo.com/b4c446cc016138263957034390c88663.png)

Final count down 

![dcd431614657b9e0078c51eff7378663.png](https://i.gyazo.com/dcd431614657b9e0078c51eff7378663.png)

Sucsess 70k orbit acchived ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

![4f862f1b8ef7d4501d886e9230ab94aa.png](https://i.gyazo.com/4f862f1b8ef7d4501d886e9230ab94aa.png)

had to tweak my craft in space again and my Nuke stage was released into space and mass has updated i also had to disable the ions completely and put them as the last stage.

if i want to re-enable the ions again that would be for ditching for re entry only.

![c458d07b49f1c60cd4107b8f5007011e.png](https://i.gyazo.com/c458d07b49f1c60cd4107b8f5007011e.png)

and i used probably around 10-35 units of fuel and oxidizer for the efficient burn of the nuke stage that's cutting it close right there ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) hope this counts on the first try.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-14T17:55:47Z" title="08/14/2015 05:55  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 14, 2015</time> by Lego8\_bit**

Can't judge the entry until I know the pad mass, Lego8\_bit. Can you share a pic in the VAB or on the pad with the KER window open fully (i.e. not compact mode in the VAB, the Vessel tab like in your later pics on the pad)?

![9902bd3bc6d3084f06ba0765dbadb3d6.jpg](https://i.gyazo.com/9902bd3bc6d3084f06ba0765dbadb3d6.jpg)
I calculate that as 7.08% payload fraction, added to the board. I couldn't see the name of your rocket, can you let me know and I'll update it?

> 
> I calculate that as 7.08% payload fraction, added to the board. I couldn't see the name of your rocket, can you let me know and I'll update it?

its eeloo Heavy lifter mk3. ill proably update the payload next time around so it stays solid.

hey nich can we see a pic of the craft please?

Maybe KER is grossly under estimating the dV. All my calculations were by hand. This is a down grade at 27% and it still cant make orbit

[Tirty Cents V3](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0iPRE-stt2Cb19IUmV5QnQ1eW8/view?usp=sharing)

![yI3qr71.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/yI3qr71.jpg)
Quick question - is UbioZur Welding allowed here? I'm working on a new rocket (HUGE payload, about the same efficiency I had as before), but the part count is killing me.

> 
> Quick question - is UbioZur Welding allowed here? I'm working on a new rocket (HUGE payload, about the same efficiency I had as before), but the part count is killing me.

Sorry, no. This challenge is intended to determine what can be done with unmodified stock parts, reducing part count by consolidating parts sidesteps that (and changes how the rocket behaves as fuel tanks are drained).
Fair enough. I'll just do the build and launch it veryyyyy slowlyyyyyy.

So update - I finally did what I set out to do today. Not only beat my previous efficiency (if only by a few fractions of a percentage), but also more than double my previous mass load! Without further ado, I give you the **Juggernaut IX**. I started with the goal of lifting 1kt into LKO. And then that wasn't enough. So I built the Juggernaut IX, and this happened....

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/NjCha)

With the payload weighing in at a massive 1519.96t, not only is my payload bigger than every single ship on the high scores here, it's bigger than many of them combined. Further, it's even more efficient than my previous, Juggernaut VI! With a launch mass of just over 6kt (6022.68t), it gives me a payload fraction of 25.24%! Not enough to bump me up in the ranks, but enough to beat my previous score. And the fact that I had just a bit of fuel left at the end of that launch means I could probably have squeezed another 0.1% out of it.... But I won't do that again! There are so many parts that it takes about 6 real seconds for 1 in game second of launch. That entire process was about an hour from launch to orbit!

Note: You could pretty easily lift an entire space station into 150km orbit with this thing. If you limit it to 1200t or so, you have plenty of fuel to raise the orbit.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-19T03:55:32Z" title="08/19/2015 03:55  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 19, 2015</time> by wolfman29**
That is a gigantic rocket, wolfman29, I admire your patience in launching it. Added to the board.

Woohoo. New Air-Breathing Single Stage Entry

Take-off mass: 62.38 t

Payload to Orbit: 28.5 t (7 full Smal Ore Tanks + 1 partial + struts)

Payload fraction: 45.69 %

It's a new personal record for me >31 t per Rapier.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/Zw5nX)

[Craft file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B34u1G2080ndVE5yMUhEV29LRHc/view)
A fine entry, Val, not only a new mass-to-Rapier record but also the new highest fraction for an SSTO. Well done, added to the board.

> 
> A fine entry, Val, not only a new mass-to-Rapier record but also the new highest fraction for an SSTO. Well done, added to the board.

Thank you.

I actually just increased the mass-to-Rapier record to [34 t](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29533-What-did-you-do-in-KSP-today?p=2171843#post2171843), but I've yet to see if I'm able to translate that into increased payload fraction.

Edit: And it's also at a point where I don't think it can be flown precisely enough without some sort of autopilot. It's so damn sensitive to pitch changes. Just slightly off and you lose speed, instead of gaining.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-31T23:07:42Z" title="08/31/2015 11:07  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 31, 2015</time> by Val**

> 
> It's so damn sensitive to pitch changes. Just slightly off and you lose speed, instead of gaining.

One SSTO I made was so twitchy I had to fly it with only trim changes (alt-W and alt-S).

Damnit Val, you beat me to my own SSTO. I was lliterally working on it when I saw your post... Good thing mines just smaller al around, or else I would have dies in blistering rage. JK, still though...

- - - Updated - - -

Like, because, it looks almost the same with an engine layout of Nuke-Rapier-Rapier-Nuke, ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif) I feel that if I post it now, you guys will think I copied. And I worked on this for a week now...

Like an addict, SpaceplaneAddict...

> 
> Woohoo. New Air-Breathing Single Stage Entry
> Take-off mass: 62.38 t
> 
> Payload to Orbit: 28.5 t (7 full Smal Ore Tanks + 1 partial + struts)
> 
> Payload fraction: 45.69 %

Val, it is now confirmed that you have unlimited time and patience.

Seriously. The C-1 payday takes 40 frikin' minutes to get to orbit!

Ooh! ooh! I have an entry!

I call it The HyperPelican!

[Album wasn't showing for some reason, so here's a link to it.](http://imgur.com/a/LAy1u)

I clipped shock cones through the engines. I'll remove them if it's a big worry, but i don't think it matters much.
